attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: Stop all future referendums from July 2016
attributes.background: Referendums cause division, animosity and pull the country apart.

attributes.action: Have the EU referendum for 28.8% that didn't vote, teens & British residents.
attributes.background: Only a quarter (26.74%) of Britain voted to LEAVE the EU. 28.8% registered voters, millions who couldn't register, 16-17 year old Brits, and UK residents, have had no say. Democracy is not a privilege of the few, and the EU referendum is incomplete and invalid currently & it must be completed.

attributes.action: to create a house of lords with 100 ELECTED members
attributes.background: austerity should of started with the amount we waste on the nearly 900 peers in the house of lords. america has 535 politicians in both houses it is time to reduce our politicians.

attributes.action: support china's claim over the south china sea
attributes.background: China's claim over the south china sea has historic routes and china has pushed for countries to recognize its rightful claim to the south china sea. Thus far however the UK has refused to do so. The UK should recognize China's claim over it to both strengthen ties and recognize a historical claim.

attributes.action: Make anyone over the age of 50 unable to vote in a Second EU Election
attributes.background:
Recently the Elderly Population of this Country has been able to Dictate over the Young Generation of this great nation.
Lets make sure that the People that are going to be affected by Brexit and other elections the most decide.
Also to make the system equal, by lowering the minimum age to 15.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum in England and Wales only
attributes.background: Scotland have voted to be part of the UK and part of EU. England and Wales have voted to leave the EU. The second referendum question should be in England and Wales only and should ask
attributes.additional_details: "Should England and Wales continue to be part of a United Kingdom that is part of the EU or be in independent country outside the EU?"

attributes.action: UK to hold a new EU referendum if Scotland leave the UK before Brexit.
attributes.background: If Scotland vote leave the UK before the EU exit the UK public should have a new EU referendum where they can consider these significantly changed circumstances.

attributes.action: EU Independence referendums for British cities and regions
attributes.background: To allow British cities and regions to hold Independence referendums and be able to choose individual EU membership. Allow individual cities and regions to group together to form a united group based on their views.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16 and stop over 65+ voting
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 and over 65+ voting should be stopped

attributes.action: Hold a Second EU Referendum for all 11 to 18 Year olds and combine the totals
attributes.background: The EU Referendum Vote held on Thursday 23rd of June 2016, was not democratic and failed to provide all people the vital information required to make an informed decision and most importantly failed to involve the most important people whose very futures depend on the vote

attributes.action: Mandate gov't to create a non partisan advisory panel for the Brexit process
attributes.background: Mandate the government to create an independent advisory body of experts (across finance, business, politics, academia etc) to support and advise on the Brexit process - to ensure the best result for the British people. Advisory Council to represent all professional spheres.
attributes.additional_details:
On June 23rd 2016, the UK voting populace voted at the EU referendum to leave the European Union - with a simple majority of approx 52%. Following this, the Prime Minister has indicated he will step aside for a Brexit government to lead the country to invoke the leaving process.
A new government will require the support and expertise of a non-political advisory body, to bring the best research and knowledge in achieving the most beneficial Brexit for the British, EU and global populations.

attributes.action: Use the EU referendum as a basis for a 2nd renegotiation of EU membership
attributes.background:
The EU referendum was a close call, only a difference of one million or so votes separated the opinions of nearly 34 million voters.

The first set of renegotiation weren't successful in the first place, thus, try again and with the added critical mass of this historical event - get a better deal.

attributes.action: Reaffirm and support equality and worker's rights in post-EU Britain.
attributes.background:
Following the vote to leave the EU, it is likely that the UK will cease to be bound by EU laws, which underpin vital legal protections for British citizens.

The undersigned call upon MPs to reaffirm those acts such as the Employment Rights Act (1996) and Equality Act (2010).
attributes.additional_details:
The undersigned also ask MPs to reject weakening of principles established in EU laws such as:
The Working Time Regulations, 
The Pregnant Workers Directive, 
The Parental Leave Directive, 
The Information and Consultation of Employees Directive (adopted as the Works Council Directive in UK law), 
The Equality Framework Directive, 
The Race Equality Directive, 
The Equal Treatment Directive, 
The Insolvency Protection Directive

attributes.action: Allow Scotland to hold another referendum.
attributes.background:
Britain is currently backing a Brexit. The live results show Scotland is clearly not in favour of leaving the EU.

Due to Britain's relationship with the EU having changed since Scotland's referendum took place, it is only fair Scotland are allowed another referendum due to circumstantial changes.

attributes.action: Make it law for sun tan lotions to show the Uva star rating on the packaging
attributes.background: The uva star rating provides us with the broad spectrum cover that the sun cream gives us. The EU standard is 3 star but advice is given that we should be looking for a 4 or 5 star. Many brands do not publish what their rating is so the consumer can not make an informed decision when buying.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bad.org.uk/for-the-public/skin-cancer/sunscreen-fact-sheet

attributes.action: Ban ice cream vans
attributes.background:
Ice cream vans are a nuisance to many people with their noise day after day, especially to housebound and those bringing up children who bear an additional burden of being pestered.

They are the least regulated of any trade in Britain, allowed door to door.

Putting up with them must end.
attributes.additional_details:
"Noise from ice-cream vans can be unwanted and intrusive." South Northamptonshire Council

"Noise from ice-cream vans is unwanted, intrusive and pollutes the environment in which we live in." Neighbours from Hell in Britain 

"aggressive selling.. should be banned" Noise Abatement Society

In 2014 in New York City alone: 1,804 complaints specifically about ice cream van music.

attributes.action: True democracy, Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures.
attributes.background: Call a referendum if you get 100,000 signatures. Regardless what it's for. bringing the power back to the people. Let the people decide the future of the UK not politicians or local government we have the power to change and do what is right for the future of the UK

attributes.action: we want the government to take control over BHS until a buyer is found.
attributes.background: Lots of people will loose their jobs at no fault of there own, we the HONEST and hard working feel that the government is not doing enough for these people who have dedicated their lives to this company, and as a tax payer I feel like many others that more should be done to safeguard there future

attributes.action:
Review how the fines system works.
Using a percentage of total income.
attributes.background:
It would be a much fairer system if the system had a set percentage of total income for any fines handed out, as such the detterant isnt the same to a someone with a high income as it may be to someone on a lower income.
It also lessens the penalty if it is having no effect on the offender.
attributes.additional_details:
I feel this is pretty self explanatory, please review how the fines system is worked, it is an unfair system that currently penalises only people with smaller incomes.

Whilst not acting as a deterrent at all to high income earners.

If the system was worked off a percentage of total income then it would be much fairer to all, no matter how much money they have.
The percentage could increase the worse the crime, this may be a larger deterrent to all offenders.

attributes.action: Increase CSA amount for paying parents on benefits.
attributes.background: At this present moment in time the flat rate for parent paying CSA towards their children is a flat rate of £7 per week regardless of how many children you have. Rightly a packet of nappies cost much higher then this. Benefit parents shouldn't get away with the responsibility of paying petty money.

attributes.action: Stop birth certificate stating "Father Unknown" when the father doesn't register
attributes.background: When registering a babies birth, if the father is not in attendance, either by being unwilling or unable, the father is shown on the certificate as Unknown. I find this unacceptable as it suggests the mother is promiscuous. Please remove the word Unkown and leave blank or allow Unwilling.

attributes.action: Impose age ratings on music videos using the same system used for films.
attributes.background: Some music videos (such as Rihanna's "Better Have My Money" video) contain themes (i.e. glorified cruelty, drug use and nudity) which are inappropriate for children but have no age restrictions.
attributes.additional_details: Parents can't always stop their children from watching videos like this as it can be shown to them by school friends, and or watched on their phones and iPads. It is not always possible for parents to know, and control, what their children are watching. And these videos can be watched by children as young as primary school age. Please sign this petition and help stop this.

attributes.action: Change the repayment threshold of Plan 1 Student Loans in line with inflation.
attributes.background: In 1998 when the government introduced Plan 1 Student loans, the repayment threshold was £15,000 which represented a significant salary level at the time. Interest is applied to the loans annually to ensure the value of the loan outstanding keeps pace with inflation.
attributes.additional_details: With inflation averaging 2.7% a year, if the repayment threshold had also been increased (in line with the interest added to the outstanding balance) in order to account for the rise in salaries to match the increase in the cost of living, the repayment threshold would now stand at £24,645.

attributes.action: Every 10 years voting right to residents to stay or leave housing association
attributes.background: Residents & tenants who live under housing association, must be given statutory voting right every 10 years.  Either they want to stay or leave current housing association. Residents being harass most, is by housing association. Urge to government to give statutory right to those vulnerable people.

attributes.action: Category D (bus) license holders to be upgraded to class 2 license for free.
attributes.background: Due to the similar size of vehicles and weight of vehicles category D (bus) show be allowed to drive class 2 vehicles.

attributes.action: Stop motor insurers voiding innocent drivers' insurance policies
attributes.background: After a non-fault road traffic accident where my spine was injured, I received notice that my insurance was to be voided due to inadvertent (or innocent) non-disclosure of material fact.  The insurer could have checked the details for free at any time, but waited til I claimed.
attributes.additional_details:
There are multiple cases where the insurer is voiding policies after a claim is made.  My argument is that they are collecting "Golden Tickets", where they let you pay a policy until they are liable for something, so removing all risk

- They have a responsibility to check the details when it is free to do so.
- They shouldn't void insurance for trivial date mix-ups on policy, but rewrite/update instead.
- After non-fault incidents insurers shouldn't be allowed to throw the claimant to the wall.

attributes.action: Allow school leavers (16) to become fully licensed SIA Security Guard/ Doormen.
attributes.background: I believe that as a school leaver the job market is extremely limited in terms of careers, the government wants 16-18 to be in employment or education but it ludicrous that i can't pursue a in security because of the law requiring you to be18.Security is where i believe my future is heading towards.
attributes.additional_details:
You must be over 18 to hold an SIA licence.
http://www.sia.homeoffice.gov.uk/Pages/licensing-before.aspx

attributes.action: Suspend tolls on the M6Toll when roadworks are in place on the M6
attributes.background: M6 roadworks bring traffic chaos to millions of drivers and businesses. More works are halving the capacity and reducing speed to 40mph for 6 months.  Relieve the stress to motorists and cost to business by suspending toll fees on M6Toll during roadworks affecting J11 to J4a.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for companies to charge late payment fees.
attributes.background: Most companies charge you today if you pay for your bill late for example Talk talk charge £10 if you don't pay on time, I think this is wrong what happens if we pay early they don't give us £10, they should be happy they have their payment.

attributes.action: Urgent call for Residential Care Home Act; specific to Elderly Care
attributes.background:
Respectfully, we, the signatories, ask that: 
All parties associated with residential care for the elderly are held legally responsible, therefore, legally accountable: Company Directors, Employees; Local Authority, Local Authority Commissioners, Social Services; Medical Practitioners.
attributes.additional_details:
1.  According to CARE QUALITY COMMISSION, 
18 January 2016, there is NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for
Registered Residential Care Home Managers, Providers 
to:
- INFORM members of staff, residents, relatives, next of kin that home has been subject to an inspection by CARE QUALITY COMMISSION.
- PROVIDE COPY of CQC INSPECTION REPORT to members of staff, in their ‘mother tongue’; to residents, relatives and next of kin.

2. Recent case has revealed that, seemingly, there is 
NO LEGAL REQUIREMENT for:  
- LOCAL AUTHORITIES to maintain controls, checks and balances of commissioned residential care homes.
- MEDICAL PRACTITIONERS to maintain controls, checks, balances of administration of drugs by residential care homes.

attributes.action: Stop police seizing vehicles that are fully legitimate with tax, mot, insurance
attributes.background: There's no protection for road users as explained and they find themselves being deprived of property and inconvenienced for no reason. This is mainly due to incompetent practice. The siezure of a vehicle should be on a factual basis and not suspicion or belief.
attributes.additional_details: The current law allows vehicles to be seized on the basis of just suspicion. The suspicion could turnout to be wrong but in the mean time seizures still take place even if the law abiding road user is at no fault of theirs. This is clearly unfair and could go as far as breaching your human rights. This procedure is a form of theft. Police have phones and access to the MID database to establish facts. It should be only fair that this procedure is followed before seizure is taken place. can u make it a law that police must prove vehicles have no insurance before siezing

attributes.action: Fund the Iraqi government to help combat Daesh
attributes.background: The government of Iraq is facing money shortages, which has an affect on the campaign to defeat Daesh. Without sufficient money, the police forces and army are at risk of inadequate training, with low supplies to tackle Daesh.
attributes.additional_details: If we can send billions to support migrants, we should be able to send cash to help out governments fighting Daesh with us. Let`s put Daesh to a end.

attributes.action: Put the national minimum wage to £6.50 per hour
attributes.background: Business will start to struggle if the price for the minimum wage aren't put down and in result shops will have to put up there prices therefore putting the value of the pound down.
attributes.additional_details: This petition is only to decrease the minimum wage back to £6.50 or lower

attributes.action: Lower Taxes on Cigarette's due to current cost in Europe
attributes.background: As a current smoker of the UK. I believe that the current taxation level on Cigarette's is far to high for the standard income of UK citizens.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pmc/articles/PMC3228562/

attributes.action: Create a "Junior" Marine corps for teens 14+ until able to join reserves
attributes.background: Many young people searching for work are considering joining Royal Marines reserves as a part time job. Facilities training potential marines at a young age is a great way to teach team work as well as getting teenagers in good health.

attributes.action: Earliest UK EU membership referendum date to be 1 year after signed EU agreement
attributes.background: The UK EU membership referendum is a critical vote for all UK citizens. PM Cameron stated he is not in a hurry to hold it. The British people must be given enough time to debate and discuss this vital matter in an open and democratic manner across the country, as happened with the Scottish Indyref.
attributes.additional_details: Time between Royal Assent for Scottish Referendum Bill and date of vote: 10 months. UK EU membership just as important. Scottish Parliament and UK local elections in Spring 2016 will interfere with thorough debates and discussions on BREXIT. A Referendum is not just an opinion poll or marketing exercise to sell consumers a product. It is a democratic process of discussion, debate, and opinion formation requiring adequate discussion time for voters to understand issues and make up their minds.

attributes.action: Legislate for a decision on Heathrow by June 2016
attributes.background: Successive governments' indecisiveness over large infrastructure projects has stifled economic growth. The latest delay in a decision about the expansion of Heathrow is unacceptable. The government should legislate to enshrine in law a timetable for a decision, either way, about Heathrow expansion.

attributes.action: Legalise DMT
attributes.background: Dimethyltryptamine (DMT) is a natural occurring molecule of the tryptamine family. When you sleep at night DMT is released in your brain producing the effect that we call “dreaming”. DMT has no known negative effects on the human body due to its natural occurrence in the brain. It is not addictive.
attributes.additional_details: It allows for an "ego" break. That is to say to leave you open to formulate new ideas and beliefs about how the user sees reality in a positive manner.  Thus I believe if done correctly in a controlled environment will help with depression, attitudes, harming beliefs, how one connects with the real world and other people, etc...

attributes.action: Review of UK voting age - Vote at 16 not at 75
attributes.background:
Change law to allow 16 & 17 year olds a right to vote in the UK and debate a maximum voting age. The referendum highlighted the reality of these issues.

People that will be affected by an election or referendum must be allowed a vote and have a voice, those that will not be affected should not.
attributes.additional_details:
Life expectancy rates are 80 years old, so people aged 75 voted for something that statistically they will only be affected by for a few years, whereas, 16 and 17 year olds, who will be affected for the rest of their lives, were not allowed to vote, this is not right.

We should also debate a maximum voting age for special referendums only, not for general elections which occur every few years where everyone over 15 should be allowed to vote.

This needs to be done, the time is now, do it.

attributes.action: Allow 14-17 year olds to have their votes on the EU added to the  voting total
attributes.background:
The EU referendum is a vote for over 18 year olds to decide whether to stay or leave

This vote affects the futures of young people, and not the elderly, who are responsible for 60% of leave votes in the 65+ category. This raises the question of: Why shouldn't youths get to decide on their future?
attributes.additional_details:
-73% of 18-24 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-62% of 25-34 year olds voted to remain in the EU
-52% of 35-44 year olds voted to remain in the EU

These facts illustrate what the people who are affected most by the vote wanted. Sadly, they are having their futures decided by the older generations, to whom the vote will not affect.

By signing this petition, you are allowing the younger generation to decide on their own future.

Source: 'BBC News: EU referendum: The result in maps and charts'

attributes.action: Have a referendum on London & Thames Valley independence
attributes.background: After the EU referendum, the UK voted to leave the EU, a decision which was not shown support by Scotland, Northern Ireland and the Thames Valley.The country has chosen to go in a direction of independence, whilst we have chosen unity.
attributes.additional_details:
The majority of the young population wanted to remain and now have to live with the consequences and an uncertain future.

We have £478 billion, enough to be the 26th richest country.

attributes.action: Declare EU referendum invalid.
attributes.background:
The EU referendum result is invalid and void.
Reasons:
1. 52% of a 72% turnout is only 37% of the eligible electorate.
2. UK citizens resident in EU over 15 years 
were not included in the electorate although these citizens are directly affected by this decision.

attributes.action: Allow EEA citizens that are living in the UK to vote in the 2nd EU referendum.
attributes.background: EEA citizens that have been living and working in the UK for at least 5 years should get the rights to vote in the 2nd EU referendum.

attributes.action: Refuse a UK visa to the rap artist known as Azealia Banks.
attributes.background: The comments made by Azealia Banks on social media forums today (11/05/16) bring her within the scope of the list of unacceptable behaviour by making statements that may foster hatred, which might lead to intercommunity violence in the UK.

attributes.action: Allow EU citizens on the UK electoral register for 5 years a vote in referendum.
attributes.background: With the cost of UK naturalisation for EU citizens being circa £2000 and requiring 3-5 years prior residence, the cost for EU citizens to gain full UK voting rights through full citizenship is extremely prohibitive. These individuals contribute immensely to the UK and yet are prevented from voting
attributes.additional_details:
It makes no sense that a UK citizen resident abroad, who hasn't been on the electoral register for up to 15 years can vote, whilst EU citizens contributing to our society and on the UK electoral register cannot.

This is further undermined by the fact that Gibraltarians, who are only in the EU by the skin of the UK's teeth, can vote in the referendum whilst citizens of fully committed EU states resident in the UK cannot!
